result.execSummary:
The defendant Natasha Dione Mills was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Good time and electronic monitoring.

Huber for work and childcare.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Natasha Dione Mills

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Natasha Dione Mills in court.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Natasha Dione Mills.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of victim notification. 

Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement. Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  


ADA Thomas Potter appears for the State of Wisconsin. Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. Additional statements by: Derek W. and Melvin M.

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 100 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 day served. Huber for work and childcare. Court STAYED the sentence(s) and placed the defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 45 days condition time in the House of Correction; good time and electronic monitoring. Report by 9-15-2022 by 5:00 pm. Huber for work and childcare.
- No firearms unless to take firearm safety class.
- Complete a firearm safety class.
- Complete a anger management class
- Provide a DNA sample. 


Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.


*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 

*Court orders filings sealed regarding social security and school information.
The original document was titled: Letter for Sentencing
The original history event date is: 08-29-2022
Information For Sentencing, filed by defense
Notice Of Right To Seek Postconviction Relief

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Elements of the Offense

Defendant Natasha Dione Mills in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Natasha Dione Mills appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.
Case adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Natasha Dione Mills in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Natasha Dione Mills appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for status. Defense requests more time. Case adjourned to Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Natasha Dione Mills in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Natasha Dione Mills appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense recently retained and requests an adjournment. Case adjourned back to Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AB, CH, and any Chili's restaurant in Milwaukee County.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Natasha Dione Mills in court.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/28/2022@02:30pm
